item.title: VBA Dialog Boxes
item.description:
You can’t use VBA very long without being exposed to dialog boxes.

They seem to pop up almost every time you select a command.

item.title: VBA MsgBox Function

item.title: VBA InputBox Function
item.description:
The VBA’s InputBox function is useful for obtaining a single piece of information from the user.

That information could be a value, a text string, or even a range address.

item.title: VBA GetOpenFilename, GetSaveAsFilename and Getting a Folder Name
item.description:
If your VBA procedure needs to ask the user for a filename, you could use the InputBox function.

An input box usually isn’t the best tool for this job, however, because most users find it difficult to remember paths, backslashes, filenames, and file extensions.
